Job Title: Mergers and Acquisitions Analyst

Location: Scottsdale, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Consulting, Finance

Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
The M&A Analyst will support the origination, structuring, negotiation and execution of acquisitions, and investments for Cardone Ventures. In this role, the M&A Analyst will work with the FP&A and Partnership team to support potential acquisition and investment opportunities
ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES
Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.
OBJECTIVES
Develop detailed financial models for M&A transactionsParticipate in all aspects of due diligence activities for additional context on active dealsAssist with the preparation of investment memoranda and presentations for the executive teamConduct research and analysis to screen and qualify potential M&A opportunitiesAssist with the development of broader strategic initiatives and investment strategiesIdentify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and Ad Hoc reports, tools and Excel dashboardsNormalize and develop financial systems to increase efficiency in reportingAggregate past results, perform variance analysis, identify trends and make recommendations for improvementsProvide financial evaluation of opportunities
COMPETENCIES
Strong fluency with Excel formulas and functionsAbility to gather and skillfully analyze financial data and identify the information needed to solve a problem effectivelyStrong understanding of financial models, budgets and financial reporting packagesDemonstrated ability and experience developing and managing complex financial modelsTeam-oriented with excellent interpersonal skills and ability to develop collaborative relationships across the organizationDriven, self-starter with a passion for excellenceAbility to work with project management software (e.g.,Asana) and G-Suite (Slides and Docs)Ability to identify inefficiencies in financial reporting and propose a potential solutionStrong understanding of how to perform variance analysisStrong aptitude for interpreting financial statements
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business or related field, or equivalent work experience2-4+ years of M&A in investment banking, private equity, corporate development, corporate finance, or management consulting experience
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer
COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITYAs an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.;If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, include the job title and source where you found this position in the subject line of your email to careers @cardoneventures.com. Already a Cardone Ventures candidate? Please connect directly with your recruiter to discuss this opportunity.

Experience Level (if available): None
